snippet: LEAD: California's first execution in 23 years was blocked today when a Federal appeals court judge said Robert Alton Harris, convicted in 1979 of the murder of two teen-age boys, might not have had adequate psychiatric help at his trial....
lead_paragraph: LEAD: California's first execution in 23 years was blocked today when a Federal appeals court judge said Robert Alton Harris, convicted in 1979 of the murder of two teen-age boys, might not have had adequate psychiatric help at his trial.

headline.main: California Execution Stayed: State Is Appealing to High Court

byline.original: By JANE GROSS, Special to The New York Times
